pullRequest.body:
Found by the linter #13653.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
### PR summary [9d349ae9d4](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/15653/commits/9d349ae9d4b1bdf62109bfa5690e2beb62dbb48a)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

No declarations were harmed in the making of this PR! üêô
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/ecafb38e-c8ef-447f-935b-bf6f8c8a9bff) for commit fbd5336e95f3e2c71220fd78a809a6247c4bcad3.
There were [no significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/8c9430e2-06bc-463f-9d3e-00f6bee412bf/to/ecafb38e-c8ef-447f-935b-bf6f8c8a9bff) against commit c0ec0639aae39a4c61d38bf19d2f78f050e4d295.

Thanks for doing this! The code itself looks good. I looked at the benchmark results in detail (checking the files with a `set_option removed`): most are fine or get slightly faster, with one or two exceptions:
- `RootsOfUnity` gets very slightly slower (170 Mio); overall instructions are neutral/better (+700 Mio)
- `Haar.OfBasis` gets appreciably slower (44,2 -> 45,6*10‚Åπ instructions, for a single line change): can you profile or benchmark that file locally? If the slow-down persists, I would rather leave the set_option and leave a comment that this is kept for performance purposes.

Feel free to maintainer merge on my behalf once you have done so.

Here are the local heartbeat counts:
```lean
Roots of unity
-- no `set_option tactic.skipAssignedInstances false in`
Used 16863 heartbeats, which is less than the current maximum of 200000.

-- with `set_option tactic.skipAssignedInstances false in`
Used 16154 heartbeats, which is less than the current maximum of 200000.
```
---
```lean
Haar of Basis
-- no `set_option tactic.skipAssignedInstances false in`
Used 48121 heartbeats, which is less than the current maximum of 200000.
-- with `set_option tactic.skipAssignedInstances false in`
Used 42718 heartbeats, which is less than the current maximum of 200000.
```
Using `set_option trace.profiler true` with and without the option shows that `Basis.prod_parallelepiped` benefits from the option, since elaboration goes from ~5 to ~4 seconds.  The following declarations in the file take much less than a second with or without the option.

Thus, removing `set_option tactic.skipAssignedInstances false in` results in a 1 second slowdown in the declaration.

I really do not know what is the cut-off time limit for preferring to add a `set_option`.

In any case, I restored the option and added a comment.
üöÄ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by Ruben-VandeVelde.

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10341100775/job/28622543438)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10341100775/job/28622543513)

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore: remove unused `set_option in`
